Results.Title: Foothills and Mountains
Results.ReviewText: I received this as a gift and I ride in the foothills and mountains near Changmai Thailand. The seat is painful for me and the shifting is rough. For the money I would definitely not recommend it as a entry level bike. It needs a lot of investments like wheel upgrades, lighter tires and a new seat. By the time you buy what you need to bring this up to speed, you can buy a higher quality bike

Results.Title: Lousy bike for the price
Results.ReviewText: Lousy bike for the price. I have had Trek's, Giants, aluminum frames, carbon frames and this bike simply cannot compete with the bike shop brands. The Shimano 105 and BB30 crank is almost impossible to find in this price range. The assembly was lengthy and difficult and I was disappointed with the gear shift and the ride quality once I FINALLY got it set up. I swapped out the rims, which I think are the biggest downfall about the bike. Save yourself a headache and skip this bike.

Results.Title: Flat tires
Results.ReviewText: I have owned this bike or 5 months now and already have had sometihng like 6 flat tires. Very frustrating. Nothing like making time for a nice 3 hour ride and then having it ruined by a flat. Maybe I should have stuck with running. Not a fan of Endurance.

ClientResponses.Name: Endurance Cycles
ClientResponses.Response: I’m sorry to hear of your experience. We highly recommend you get custom fitted for any road bike, including Endurance. It is possible to make many adjustments on the Apex 2 – including handlebar height & angle and seat height & angle – that may help minimize hand and shoulder pain. Lastly, as a rider myself, I know flats are frustrating. It may be that you have just been unlucky, but if you have any particular issues with your route, such as a lot of new construction with related road debris, then also ask during your custom fitting about tires that may be better suited to your route.

Results.Title: Frustrating after first week
Results.ReviewText: Owned the bike for one week now and think its awful! Had to bring it to a pro bike shop as the derailleur cables are a tricky which cost me another $150. I also found that the tires needed some continental gatorskins to handle the thorns (I live in the southwest). That's another $60. By the time I got this thing up to speed, I had invested over $200. Wishing I just coughted up more money up front and got a better quality bike.

ClientResponses.Name: Bradley
ClientResponses.Response: We're so sorry that you've had a bad experience!  Endurance Cycles has partnered with pro bike shops across the country to ensure that our customers get free fittings.  Please check out the list of our providers here in Customer Service section of our website for any of your future needs.  To make up for this bad experience you've had, someone from our Customer Service department will be contacting you to make reparations.  Please accept our apologies and give us another chance to win your business.

Results.Title: Not a good choice if you
Results.ReviewText: First bike owner, first bike I bought. Believe everything they say about the bike in the reviews - it's touch and go. Two things I would recommend: MAKE SURE YOU GET FITTED! I had to saw off a bit of the seatpost in order to have it lowered enough for my frame, and I had the handlebars adjusted. It was extremely close to not being the right fit, but the authorized Endurance dealer I went to helped a ton. If there had been more information about the fit I would have figured out that it just wasn't the right choice for someone who is only 5' lke me.

Results.Title: Great on hills but seat hurts!
Results.ReviewText: I am blessed with hills everywhere I ride (said with sarcasm..haha) My new Apex 2 is awesome on the hills.. A steady ride to the top without feeling exhausted when I get there. With the women's design, it is a very comfortable reach to both handlebars & pedals allowing for longer rides without fatigue. I didn't like the seat (sorry seat designers) & did need to replace it. I am a happy cyclist that now looks forward to the climb. The seat was a big enough issue that I had to knock my review down. I really think a good seat should come standard.

Results.Title: Torturous seat
Results.ReviewText: This bike is awesome - big EXCEPT. The seat will kill you! :) It is my first road bike, but I have already ridden it successfully for a few long rides (20 to 50K)! The only thing I would change about it are the seat (it is an instrument of torture). The seat made me so crazy I had to bump it from 5 stars down to 3. Invest in a new seat and you'll be happy.

Results.Title: Great components
Results.ReviewText: I bought thisb/c it had the better components: FSA crank and 105 rear mech. I was not disappointed. The color is a nice flat black, easy to keep clean. The build quality is great and it is an excellent entry-level road bike. The wheelset is not bad, about 2000g....not aero, but at this price/level riders like me don't need aero wheels. Front rim is radial spoked, the rear is 2x. Most of the bargain wheelsets you can buy are about the same weight or heavier so stick with the wheelset on it until you're read to spend $300-$450 on a decent set. Personally, I'd buy a set of rims and the hubs I want and take them to my LBS; you'll get what you want and get better quality for your money. Brakes are OK, I already switched mine to 105 front/rear and better pads but the Pro-Max brakes do work just OK to start. Something to note, my front brake did NOT come installed so you need to know at least a little bit to get it ready to ride, or take it to your local dealer and have them do a pro-tune on it. Worth the money and definitely worth introducing yourself to your local dealer because you will need them sooner or later. Saddle is junk, toss it, I'm using Planet Bike 5020 Women's ARS Standard Anatomic Relief Saddle with Gel and it's great. Pedals I didn't even use, immediately installed my Delta Exustars, but the boxed pedals come with toe clips/straps. I'm not sure why seats are included on bikes like this, because many riders have their own preferences.

Results.Title: Excellent build quality
Results.ReviewText: When this bike first arrived, I got a friend from the gym to help me carry the box from my front porch to the living room, where we unpacked it. 11 days later, after a few quick trips to the local bike shop for a some extra screws, new calipers and cables and a new bottom bracket, my baby was born.. I call her Apex. I don't have any complaints, but if I did have one it might be that the head tube seems to be separating from the down tube above the front fork, and kind of wiggles a bit. I'm not sure if that's bad or not, but so far there have been no problems beyond a broken seat clamp and a snapped pedal.

Results.Title: Surge of Energy
Results.ReviewText: When this bike showed up at my doorsteps I felt a surge of energy. Once removed from the box, the bike practically put itself together automatically and adjusted everything to my liking. On the first ride I easily broke the sound barrier. And the color matches my pro kit perfectly to every detail the black is a magical black. Handlebars and positions are comfortable, and the brake levers are close enough to match my handes (which was a problem with my old bike)

Results.Title: Great technology
Results.ReviewText: Having never seen this before, all I can say is Wow! There are so many things on this bike I don't recognize...and I ride. Alot. This leads me to believe only one thing. Endurance clearly has some new biking technology that they are just now bestowing on the rest of the biking world. spokes. This is superb! And a 11 speed drive train? I new I wasting all sorts of efficiency on my Shimano 20 speed. And by the looks of the break levers, this bike will no doubt usher in a new age of ergo-comfort cycling. And all of this on Endurance's classic Apex platform. And let's not forget the most space-age of aluminum alloys.

Results.Title: Focused on fitting
Results.ReviewText: It's really exciting to see a new brand focusing on bike fitting, I've been riding for years and it's always hard for me to find a bike to fit me perfectly. Their concept is good, and I like the color and graphics. Seat is just ok but schimano components are more than what i would expect in this price range.

Results.Title: I love cycling!
Results.ReviewText: I rode on an old (vintage) Trek borrowed from a friend for about five months (including one triathlon) before realizing I loved cycling and needed to invest myself. This was the perfect bike for me. I knew I wanted a Endurance after I fell in love with the sport even on a 25 year old ride. I planned on getting the entry level Endurance but after research and discussion with my pro shop, I felt like a bit of an upgrade would be a better long term fit for me. I am so happy I made that decision. I am addicting to cycling with my new bike, I go as much as I can. The gear shifting is extremely smooth, the bike is light, and the ride is very smooth. I absolutely love it. Even after having only cycled since June, I'm Endurance loyal. I'm training for more triathlons in the spring and then my first IronMan 70.3 in September! Thank you, Endurance, I love my bike! I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this bike for a beginner who doesn't want to outgrow a entry level soon up to a seasoned rider. Fantastic bike!

Results.Title: Great on climbs
Results.ReviewText: Love the mean look of this shiney black & white bike, I have the Apex 1 which I love but the Apex 2 is lighter and is so fast! The gearing is great on the climbs and it descends really well and the flats are a joy. Internal cable routing keeps it tidy and looking great.

Results.Title: Matte finish is nice
Results.ReviewText: I love it. Endurance has always been one of my favorite brands.The body style with the matte finish is nice and really stands out from other bikes. The shifting with the 105 is perfect. All the other out of box components are pretty good. I had one issue with the tires and had to change them out.

Results.Title: This bike is a steal
Results.ReviewText: 500 Mile review. Local bike store agreed this bike was a steal at under $600. My husband ordered the Storm 2 and he said the same about it. The bike rides well, really well. The fork does a nice job of reducing road chatter and the Shimano 105 group set is smooth. I wouldn't say this bike kills hills, but they also don't stand in its way. The double chain ring serves its purpose, and from what I've read a triple wouldn't be any huge benefit unless you're really climbing. I swapped pedals from the provided wellgo to Shimano M530 SPD. I've found the seat adequate with no neat to change for now. All in all, I couldn't be more satisfied.

Results.Title: Way better
Results.ReviewText: Before purchasing my Endurance Apex 2, I was riding an Electra Townie. I love my Townie dearly but after doing a Gran Fondo (60 miles) on it, I realized I REALLY needed to upgrade to a road bike. Since this was a large purchase for me, I was very diligent in my research. I wanted a bike that was entry-level enough for a beginner but something that would last me for several years; basically I didn't want to out grow my new bike as quickly as I had my Townie. After months of exhausting research I settled on the Apex 2 and I have to say - I could not be more pleased! I've had it just under a month and I've logged about 200 miles. I can't believe how smooth it rides, how lightweight, and how easy it handles. Overall, it's fantastic!! I'm already planning my next Gran Fondo in September!

Results.Title: First road bike
Results.ReviewText: For the most part, I absolutely love my Apex 2. This is my first road bike, and I have transitioned from mountain biking to regular training with no significant problems on this bike. It is very lightweight, and the overall geometry and fit is great. I replaced the seat with a split-nose model for comfort, and now I find I have no problem taking the bike on 4+ hour rides. My one complaint is that the braking/shifting levers are very poorly positioned for small hands. I am 5' 2" and purchased a 47 frame, but the brakes are one size fits all. I am not able to brake from the hoods, even with the largest inserts available to push the handles towards me. Even trying to keep my hands stretched to a "ready" position for braking gives me hand pain for a few days after a long ride. I would recommend trying this out in-store if you have smaller hands; otherwise, really awesome, reliable bike.

Results.Title: Comfortable
Results.ReviewText: The Endurance Apex 2 has been a wonderful bike so far. I am very pleased with how comfortable the seat is and how natural it feels to ride the bike. As a beginning cyclist training for my first triathlon, I feel confident training on the Apex. It has been very good not only on flat rides and ascents and descents alike. It has a good amount of gear options and the brakes are responsive. I would definitely recommend this bike!

Results.Title: Great value for everyday riding
Results.ReviewText: I've only had my Apex about 4 months. It's my third bike since I started road riding and it is a great value - great for everyday riding. I plan to eventually replace the stock tires with Vittoria CTS for better flat protection but I can't complain and would buy this again. Good combination of weight, price, comfort.
